metadata.title: CVE-2016-6236 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The setup_imginfo_jpg function in lepton/jpgcoder.cc in Dropbox lepton 1.0allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read)via a crafted jpeg file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lepton - 1.2.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lepton package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-1').
